dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the propeller shaft extends into a large turbine. S continues on, past huge rusting diesel burners, disappear into the darkness above her, when ANOTHER BOOM SOUNDS. She turns, shinning her light back from where she came.   Nothing moves. Not a sound, but for her breathing and may her heart pounding in her chest. ANOTHER BOOM SOUNDS, aga echoing distantly in the silence. She shines her light th the line of burners. Nothing moves. Epps moves quietly between the burners. She comes to a ma watertight door at the bulkhead. She steps through, findi herself standing between a row of huge oil storage tanks. THE BOOMING SOUNDS AGAIN, closer, as suddenly stopping. She moves on, cautiously walking between the tanks, holdi her light out before her. She comes to the end of the  compartment and another bulkhead. The BOOMING SOUNDS, sti closer. She turns the light into the recesses, showing ru machinery and a stack of oil drums. She approaches, holding the shotgun up. As she nears, the BOOMING SOUNDS AGAIN. She stops. It is coming from here. She tenses, raising the shotgun, holding the light as ste as she can manage. The BOOMING SOUNDS YET AGAIN. It is  metallic and staccato. She stops in the corner beside an oil drum. Several drums have toppled and lie scattered in a pile when a draft sti her hair. She shines her light up to see that she stands the bottom of a giant hatchway shaft rising all the way  through the ship to the top deck and an echoey breeze tha betrays a throughway to the outside. The BOOMING SOUNDS AGAIN, this time coming from the pile oil drums. She steps closer, raising the shotgun, ready t fire. A beat as she summons her courage, then reaches out push a drum with her foot, when A BLUR EXPLODES OUT AT HE She fires the shotgun and a spray of buckshot glances off the steel bulkhead in a shower of sparks, a flurry of fre flapping whizzing by her head as she looks up to see a la albatross flying back up the hatchway shaft toward the to of the ship and freedom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy to Epps. She settles back, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy to Epps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking her radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just shoot at something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just a bird. Just a stupid  bird. She wipes her brow on her sleeve, holding there a moment, when she smells something really awful. She steps forward, following the smell, pushing aside the toppled oil drums to see an unidentifiable form in the be of her flashlight. She steps still closer, training her l on the form to see that it is a human torso.  A large gas runs up its middle and the clothing has been torn by  scavenging birds. She hesitates, then steps still closer when she steps on  something. She starts, then shines the light on the deck front of her where the body's decaying head looks back wi wide, unseeing eyes. It takes everything she has just to hold there. She shine her light back to the headless torso. She shines her light beyond that, and up, to reveal a ben steam pipe hanging out over the deck, stained with dried  blood, a pair of legs dangling from the pipe when, just b her, a booted foot comes into frame, lightly touching her She spins around to see another body above her. Except th one hangs in one piece, suspended from another bent steam pipe. It has been impaled length-wise on the pipe from re to mouth. One of its arms has rotted off and lies on the deck below it.  A few feet away, a third body hangs impaled from ano bent pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lantern illuminates the impaled bodies and their variou rotting parts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho-ly shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't have happened much more  than a month ago. Greer, Dodge, and Epps look on as Murphy kneels over the  remains of the headless torso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bodies're too fresh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fresh ain't the first word that comes  to mind. Murphy checks the pockets, finding a wallet. He looks thr it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greek citizen. Merchant navy. (standing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously we aren't the first to  come across this ship. They probably  stumbled across it just like we did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And look what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn barbaric is what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be meant as a warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away. Or else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of the gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd be my guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So whoever did this might still be  around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe Epps's mystery man had something  to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. A beat as they consider the implications of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what? We report this? Call the  Coastguard? Another beat as they hold there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not be too hasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Hell, what difference does it  make if we report it now or later?   We call this in now, gonna be  Coastguard, FBI, who knows who, all  over the place. A beat as nobody's too sure about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge, if this isn't incentive enough  to fix that boat, I don't know what  is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge fires up a compressor, which feebly comes to life,  turning over the turbine, then sputtering out in a cloud smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the seals and gaskets're shot.   Anything that was rubber burned up. Murphy stands at the doorway, looking on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you use something else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might be able to find something on  the ship. But it's gonna take time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what you need to do. Just do it  fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps sleeps in her bunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge and Greer climb down in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need lag bolts, especially one  inch standard. And sheet metal.   Preferably steel, about a sixteenth  of an inch. Aluminium, even tin'll  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't no mechanic, just so you  know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You find anything that even looks  like a compressor. I don't care what,  grab it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy stands in the cramped room, full of radios and  communications equipment. He looks through the shelves an cabinets, when he opens a drawer to find a dusty bound bo He pulls it back, opening it to see that it is a radio ca log. He takes a seat, paging through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer works to disassemble a compressor mechanism. He has difficulty getting the right purchase with his wrench, wh he slips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit! A beat as he inspects his hand. In the silence A DISTANT  SHRIEK SOUNDS, maybe metal against metal or maybe human,  somewhere in the ship. He holds there, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge? He moves on, shinning his light as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer moves along in the darkness when he hears THE SHRIE AGAIN coming from somewhere in the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer walks up a stairway, stepping into a darkened  passageway. The SHRIEKING SOUNDS, THIS TIME CLOSER, as it echoes through the ship. He stops, holding there to liste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer comes out onto another deck, stopping there. He loo down the passageway a beat, then moves on. He passes thro a hatchway in a bulkhead when A MUSIC BOX CAN BE DISTANTL HEARD. He stops. The song is "DAISY" ("Daisy, Daisy, give your answer do. I'm half crazy, oh for the love of you.") He holds there, listening intently. A door stands open at the other end of the passage. The MUSIC COMES FROM HERE. moves forward, walking toward the end of the passage, and the light falling from the open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy pages forward to the last page of the radio call l book. On the page his finger runs down the columns of entries,  coming to "TRANSMISSION 1 Feb 53 21:34 hrs GMT. Engine tr notification made to passing vessel 'St. Charles.'" His finger moves down to the next entry, coming to:  "TRANSMISSION 2 Feb 53 09:52 hrs GMT. Dead in Water.   Notification made to passing vessel 'Normandy.'" His finger continues: "TRANSMISSION 2 Feb 53 14:07 hrs GM Captain relieved of command. Notification made to passing vessel 'China Sea.'"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain relieved of command. He holds there a moment, moving his finger down to the fi entry, reading: "TRANSMISSION 2 Feb 53 21:24 hrs GMT. Gen

dialogues.speaker: SOS."
dialogues.text: He turns the page to see only the words "GOD SAVE US" scr in faded red ink. A beat as he holds there, when a CHANNE OPENS WITH A SHORT BURST ON MURPHY'S RADIO. He looks to i but there is no response from the other end. Another SHOR BURST AND THE CHANNEL OPENS AGAIN. This time it remains o but no one says anything on the other end, UNTIL THE CHAN CLOSES AGAIN. Murphy takes the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Murphy. Anybody trying to  call me? Over. He waits as no response comes, then THE CHANNEL OPENS AGA Only silence from the other end as someone seems to be th but is not saying anything. Murphy presses the talk butto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer? Dodge? Again, there is no response, until the CHANNEL OPENS. Mur holds there as he is answered by silence, WHEN A GRAVELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Cock-a-doodle-doo," said the rooster  to the crow. "Where are you now? I  know, but won't say so." Murphy is momentarily stunned. He hits the talk button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this? The RADIO CHANNEL OPENS. Only silence comes back, as if  someone were there but not speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this!! The CAMERA PUSHES IN AS MURPHY LISTENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penny whistle toy. Penny whistle  toy. Penny whistle toy. Penny whistle  toy. The CHANNEL CLOSES as the CAMERA STOPS CLOSE ON MURPHY.   Murphy squeezes the talk button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer! Dodge! Only silence comes back from the radio when A MAN'S BLOOD CURDLING SCREAM sounds from somewhere in the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy moves quickly down the passageway when his radio  sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge to Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better get down here quick,  skipper. I'm on "C" deck. Cabin 400.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you better see this for  yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy comes down the stairs and into the passageway we s Greer in earlier. At the end, the light from the cabin fa from the open door as he approaches.

dialogues.speaker: AT CABIN 400
dialogues.text: As Murphy comes to the door to see Dodge standing in the  middle of the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found him like this. Greer is lying supine on the floor. His legs are rigid an his trunk is extended. His arms are flexed and twisted so that the palms are facing away, fingers splayed, wrists  quaking over his chest as they fight to touch each other. Murphy kneels beside him. Greer's eyelids are half closed his eyes rolled up into his head. His jaw is clenched, fa contorted in a bizarre grimace. And he speaks, uttering  nonsense words in harsh expulsions, as though speaking in tongues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oragishlaoomnudrasadrafantoshviska  getofedobrodijotosiantosg.

dialogues.speaker: AN EYE
dialogues.text: As a light shines in it, the pupil is fixed and dilated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to say.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Greer lies unconscious on a bunk, now quiet, no longer se as Epps shines a flashlight into his eye, Dodge and Murph looking on. She turns it off, standing upright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no doctor. But I'd say he's in a  coma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what else you'd call  it. He's breathing on his own, but  his pupils are completely blown out.  He's totally unresponsive to pain. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard a scream. When I got there I  found him on the floor. He was having  some kind of seizure. I didn't see  anybody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must've seen something. A beat as they consider this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other than the obvious, there's  nothing wrong with him that I can  see, not on the outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what the hell happened to him? Another beat as they hold there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just before I heard him yell there  was somebody on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. No. Not Greer.   Somebody. Another long beat as they think about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a man's voice. Repeating some  sort of children's rhyme. I don't  know, it didn't make any sense. You  didn't hear it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me. Another beat as this sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking to Greer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call us in. Dodge, see how many  signal flares you can scrounge up. (to Epps, meaning  Dodge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep an eye on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gas lantern sits on the map table illuminating Murphy a he holds the radio mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: United States Coastguard, United  States Coastguard, United States  Coastguard. This is tugboat Arctic  Warrior whiskey alpha sierra bravo  four zero niner two. Over. No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: United States Coastguard, United  States Coastguard, United States  Coastguard. This is tugboat Arctic  Warrior whiskey alpha sierra bravo  four zero niner two. Over. Again, no response. He holds there, then finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayday. Mayday. Mayday. To any vessel.  This is Arctic Warrior.  Arctic  Warrior. Arctic Warrior.  Whiskey  alpha sierra bravo four zero niner  two. Last known position one seven  four west, five seven north. I am  afloat and drifting.  Require  immediate medical assistance for one  person, possibly comatose. I am a  one hundred twenty foot civilian  tug, hove to at port bow of disabled  passenger liner Chimera. I repeat,  Chimera. Over. Only the desolate WHITE NOISE OF EMPTY AIR COMES BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer lies unconscious as Epps looks on at him. The door  comes open and Murphy steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same. Any luck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'll try again later. A beat as they look on at Greer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy and Epps sit at the galley table. Epps reads the l book Murphy found in the radio room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're dead in the water that  morning. Four hours later the  captain's relieved of his command.   And that evening they issue a general  SOS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Possibly false. Hence the IMA record  of being lost at sea. I don't think  mutiny's out of the question here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking a seat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a passenger ship in 1953?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they knew what they were carrying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saying they mutinied for the  gold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they were close enough to shore,  they probably figured they could get  away in the lifeboats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only something must've gone wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, way wrong. A beat as they consider it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. I got a question. Just from a,  you know, purely technical standpoint.  We call the Coastguard.  Coastguard  shows up. What exactly is the plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they're gonna be asking a lot  of questions. About us. About those  bodies. About the gold. Seems like  we oughta be prepared is all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess the best strategy's just to  tell them the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well. The truth is one thing.   When there's more than a few hundred  million dollars involved, that's a  whole new deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you propose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For starters, getting that gold off  the ship. What they don't know about  isn't gonna bother them. A beat as Murphy holds there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way we're gonna hide a  few thousand pounds of gold from the  Coastguard here. Besides, it'll be  safer where it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all due respect, skipper. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of that up there's mine. I'd  kinda like to have a little say in  what happens to it. A beat as Murphy looks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what, Dodge. Once we get  back to shore, you can do whatever  you want with your share. But until  then, the gold stays right where it  is. Dodge holds there. He looks to Epps a beat, takes a drink coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun comes up over a spectacular cloud bank as the Arc Warrior drifts alongside the Chimera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy crosses to the deck house, climbs the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy opens the door, stopping dead in his tracks. A bea He steps forward, crossing to the corner. The radio set lies before him, dented in and completely  demolished, as if someone had taken a bat to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge works on one of the turbines when he is grabbed fro behind and shoved into the wall. Murphy holds him fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what the hell do you think you're  doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking  about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you can tell me then. Murphy shoves him hard into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radio!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not having a clue)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radio. Oh, yeah, the radio. Murphy tightens his grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, willya? What about the  radio?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You smashed it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't want us calling anybody.   Too liable to ruin your big payday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't touch the fucking radio. Murphy tightens his grip still more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't touch the fucking radio! (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever occur to you there's somebody  else on that boat, skipper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conveniently enough for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I didn't touch it. Alright? Murphy holds there a beat longer. He shoves Dodge back le him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Dodge checks his throat as Murphy looks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy. They turn to see Epps in the hatchway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Greer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer stands at the galley sink finishing off the last of jug of water as Murphy and the others step in. He turns t see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never been more thirsty in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink up then. Greer smiles, raising the jug to drink as the others take seat, looking on at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost my sea legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any dizziness?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headache, nausea, lights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sudden flashes of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What day is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Tuesday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong. It's Friday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try Wednesday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Wednesday. A beat as they all hold there. Greer takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last thing I remember I was aboard  the Chimera. Down somewhere in there  scavenging around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been out for about a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge found you out cold in one of  the cabins. Greer only holds there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We heard you scream. Any idea what  you might've seen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could tell you. I'd be real  interested to know myself. Another beat as they hold there, as Greer takes another d of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ah... the radio's out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody took it out of commission  last night. A beat as they all hold there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smashed it up pretty bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, who -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skipper seems to think I did it.  That I'm more interested in that  gold than my own safety or the safety  of my fellow shipmates. A beat as they hold there, as Murphy looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell no. You think I'm crazy? Another beat as they hold there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regardless of how it happened, there  isn't much of a chance to fix it.  The odds of another vessel in range  of the walkie-talkies are almost  astronomical. So, as of today, we're  pretty much on our own out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps and Murphy, carrying the shotgun, make their way in ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer stops before a mirror to see himself. He finds an  aspirin bottle, goes to open it. And as he does so, he se that his hand is shaking uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge works over the turbine. He stops, holding there. He looks on at the plugs and wires and hoses. A beat. He begins pulling out the hoses and wires, grabbing at th yanking them loose, breaking them off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chassis comes off an old radio to reveal a dusty  assortment of tubes and condensers. Murphy looks on at it

dialogues.speaker: WITH EPPS
dialogues.text: A tattered, bound book lies in the refuse of a forgotten  corner. Epps picks it up. The cover has been ripped off a the pages are torn. But, as she looks through it, she see that it is the ship's log.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy. Murphy steps over as she pages through the log book to th very end. The last pages have been ripped out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like part of the general log. Epps points to a page that has been incompletely ripped o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The crew have gone mad with greed  and fight among themselves like wild  dogs over fresh kill."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: February first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same day she supposedly went  down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must not've been the captain's entry.  He was probably out of the picture  by then. Epps continues to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Their lacking diligence has  undoubtedly caused the collision.   Distress calls have been made."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collision? With what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The page's missing. Then their SOS  was real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But where's the damage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the other ship took the worst  of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it was a ship she hit. A beat as they hold there, when his radio CRACKLES TO LIF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge to Murphy! Murphy reaches down for his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better get down here right now!   We're taking water! Big time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy and Epps jump from the deck crane as the tug is  starting to list to one side. He crosses to the deck hous and the open engine room hatch to see that it is rapidly  filling with seawater as Greer and Dodge scramble to set pump hose over the DIN OF THE PUMPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turbine chamber on number two must've  blown! Took out part of the hull!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not gonna be able to pump it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Everybody grab your gear!   This' is where we get off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tug is listing radically to the side, its deck awash  with seawater, as Epps, Greer, and Murphy scramble with t gear to the crane. Water is starting to pour out of the deckhouse hatch as t towering framework rising over the pilothouse stabs  precariously at the bow of the Chimera. Murphy stops to shout back at the deckhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water is starting to pour in as the entire cabin lurches one side. Dodge wades through toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps pulls herself up onto the deck, Greer following behi then Murphy. Dodge can be seen stepping from the deckhouse on the tug, which now lists at a near 45 degree angle.

dialogues.speaker: WITH DODGE
dialogues.text: Dodge stumbles toward the bow, slipping on the wet deck. goes down, sliding into the water that washes over the  starboard rail. He pulls himself up, using a cleat to push off. A deck lo opens and the contents tumble around him. He struggles to pull himself up to the base of the pilothouse. He climbs and edges his way toward the bow.

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE OTHERS
dialogues.text: Epps, Greer and Murphy look on as Dodge climbs up on the  skewed deck crane.

dialogues.speaker: WITH DODGE
dialogues.text: The tug is slowly lurching over as Dodge climbs the crane the top of which is sweeping away from the Chimera. Below, the decks of the tug are swept with seawater as it sinks lower and lower.

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE OTHERS
dialogues.text: They look on as Dodge climbs toward them, the sinking tug pulling Dodge and the crane away from the ship. Greer pulls back a line, tying it into the deck railing.

dialogues.speaker: WITH DODGE
dialogues.text: As Dodge makes his way up, he's forced to climb onto the  other side of the crane to keep from dangling over the wa Above, Greer casts a line. It falls near, but out of reac as the swell of the water starts to swing the crane to an fro.  Dodge reaches out for the line again, his hand comi close but not close enough. The swell brings the crane toward the boat one last time Dodge reaches out, his fingers just coming to the line,  coaxing it into his grasp. He pulls it back and hangs on, the crane sways back with the foundering boat. The crane falls away from Dodge, leaving him hanging in s by the line from the bow of the Chimera.

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE OTHERS
dialogues.text: Murphy, Greer and Epps look on as Dodge hangs over the wa and the tug as its stern slowly sinks beneath the waves. Dodge climbs the line toward the bow railing as the tug r still further to port, the pilothouse dipping into the se slipping lower and lower.

dialogues.speaker: WITH DODGE
dialogues.text: As he pulls himself upward, coming to the bottom of the r well on the Chimera where Murphy reaches out, just short Dodge's hand. A SCREECHING SOUNDS and they turn to see the twin tow cab coming taught against the hull in the anchor alley's of t Chimera as the sinking tug pulls them tight. With a CONCUSSIVE STRIKE, one cable is freed, snapping ag the Chimera's hull like a giant steel guitar string.  It  starts sliding along the hull as the tug drifts, pulling cable with it, toward Dodge as he dangles in mid air. Dodge pulls himself up, reaching for Murphy, but still sh A LOUD HISSING SOUNDS and Dodge turns to see misty air  escaping from ports and deck vents as the encroaching wat forces it out of the tug below decks. The tow cable LOUDLY SCRAPES THE HULL in a shower of rust as Dodge struggles to pull himself up. Murphy reaches out as Dodge extends as far as he can, the hands barely reaching. The tow cable is a mere few feet away and closing, ready scrape Dodge into the water or smear him across the hull  like a bug on a windshield, when Dodge pulls himself up w everything he's got and Murphy grabs his hand. Murphy pulls, lifting Dodge, as Greer grabs Dodge's other hand and they pull him up, the tow cable sweeping by with SICKENING GRINDING SOUND OF HEAVY STEEL AGAINST STEEL. Dodge turns to see the bow of the tug dip below the surfa slowly going under until disappearing with a last exhalat of misty air. The pilothouse is next to go, the last of i slipping into the frothing water, then the crane, finally disappearing altogether into the depths. A long beat as they hold there in the sudden silence, pha bubbles rising to the surface where the tug once stood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boot punches through a rotten wood hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That just about says it all. Greer stands at the bow of a lifeboat suspended from haly above the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rotten stem to stern. Guess you  couldn't expect much else. Greer jumps down as Murphy, Dodge, and Epps look on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ain't exactly in what you'd call  your high traffic neighborhood either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coast guard has our last position.  They'll send somebody out soon enough.  A ship this size you can't exactly  miss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good bet they'll be asking a  lot of questions when they get here  too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let 'em ask. This ship's legally  ours now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they find out what it's carrying,  they may not be so interested in  what's legal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you shoulda thought a that  before you scuttled our boat. Dodge turns to see Greer. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The turbine blew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme see, was that before or after  the oil fire? A beat. Dodge takes a swing at Greer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Dodge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, easy. Murphy holds on to Dodge as he will have none of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gettin' a little hot under the collar,  I'd say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be a little too the truth, eh  Dodge? Dodge jumps forward again, but Murphy hangs on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, shut the hell up. Murphy shoves Dodge back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of you. I don't want to hear it  again. A beat as Greer and Murphy hold there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So just stow it. You understand? (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't need this right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire burns in an oil drum as Epps, Murphy, Dodge and Gr sit around it in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps steps in. She shines her light on the room. It is ex as it was left. She crosses to the bed, shining her light under it. She sits down, trying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge moves in the darkness, coming to the corner where t stacked gold ingots rest. He looks on at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be down here alone. Dodge turns to see Murphy standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wanted to check on our little  baby. A beat as they look on at the gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That oughta buy a man pretty much  anything he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If money can buy what he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't figure there's much I want  money can't buy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you're a lucky man. Murphy tosses the shotgun to Dodge, who catches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll stand the watch on deck tonight.  You're up first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Murphy holds there a beat longer, then turns to go, as Do looks after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grey chop gently rocks the Chimera, smoke rising from t top deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer and Dodge tend the flames of three fire barrels, ad broken up furniture to create heavy signal smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy moves through the pantry area with a pillow case,  scavenging for food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps scavenges for food in the semi-darkness of the large open galley, when a MOVEMENT CAN BE HEARD SOMEWHERE BEYON THE ENTRY separating the galley from the outer passageway

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy? No one answers. She looks off across the stillness of the galley. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps steps into the passageway. Directly across is the en to the swimming pool. She walks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps steps in. Light falls in from the dirty port holes a the ceiling, every movement echoing off the hard tile wal She holds there a beat, then turns to go when she sees a  GIRL of about 16 facing her on the other side of the pool Epps holds there, as the girl only looks back. She is  porcelain white, flaxen hair drawn behind her head, her  clothing hanging loosely from a frail body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must leave. A beat as Epps stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? From this distance and in the light it is hard to fully  discern the girl's features.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's great evil here, more than  you can know. Leave now or you may  never leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- A HATCH CLOSES SOMEWHERE IN THE SHIP. Epps turns to look. When she turns back the girl is gone. A quiet "TICK" SOUN ECHOES in the pool. She looks down to see that the pool i now very, very deep, like a mine shaft falling away into depths. And, as she stands there, dark water is quickly r up from the bottom. She steps back as the water gradually fills the pool to t top. It is very dark and the bottom is indiscernible, whe the water begins to churn, as from bubbles of air reachin the surface. Epps steps closer, looking on as a faint red glow can be seen deep in the water below the churning bub As she watches, the red glow grows in intensity. The glow spreads, illuminating a broad area until it becomes clear that the water is not water at all but blood. And, as the light grows still brighter, a figure is  illuminated, well below the surface as it seems to rise u Epps looks on as the figure rises higher into the light. is a MAN, fighting desperately to reach the surface. The  bubbles that rise up are produced from his silent screams Epps starts forward, but another figure rises to the same point, a WOMAN, also struggling. Another MAN floats up, t another, and another, people floating up, fighting desper to reach the surface, unable to do so, drowning in blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God.... Epps reaches out over the edge, plunging her hand into th blood, reaching for the man's hand, but they are too far  apart. She struggles desperately as the man fights to get to the surface. The others are fighting for the surface too, as Epps reac out, near tears, helpless to do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!! Everything suddenly stops. A beat as Epps only holds ther The blood is gone, as are the people. The pool is back to its normal state as though nothing had happened, Epps loo on in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? Epps looks up to see Murphy standing at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (looking back to the  pool)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, fine. A beat as she holds there, looking on at the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer, Murphy, Dodge, and Epps sit on deck around the fir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd think on a ship this size  there'd be something left to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After fifty years there ain't nothin'  left but shoe leather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow we'll see if we can't find  some line and tackle. Use some of  those bodies below decks for bait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a charming thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can always start shooting birds. Epps coaxes a hit out of her last cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What say, Epps? You up for some  roasted albatross?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snuffing it out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND OF SOMEONE BREATHING HARD CAN BE HEARD in the d room. As the CAMERA SLOWLY MOVES INTO THE ROOM, we see th it is Greer, lying on the bed. His body is tense and his  arms arch rigidly toward his chest. His jaw is clenched a he expels harsh, guttural utterances, experiencing someth between a night terror and a seizure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheets of rain come down on the deck in the grey light of morning. Murphy stands on the bridge, looking off at it c down when Greer steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like we're in a strong current. (closing the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be making almost five knots  full on ass backwards. Greer crosses to the window, stepping up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nasty little swell outa the north  west too. Murphy nods as he looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just hope somebody sees us  first out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A file drawer comes open, revealing ticket receipts. Epps looks on at it. The receipts are labeled "FULL FARE  PASSAGES" and are divided by first, second, and third cla She goes through them, coming to a section that says

dialogues.speaker: "ACCOMPANIED CHILDREN."
dialogues.text: She pulls out the folder, laying it on the counter, openi it. The first page is a receipt for a single passage to  Halifax for a Tatterly, Stephen age: 14. She pulls it bac to reveal another, Wilson, Harold age: 4. Another, Vitti, Angela age: 17. She pages through the stack, looking at the ages: 3, 15, 11, 1, until coming across a 9. She looks to the name, Kl David, a boy. She continues paging through the receipts c to another 9. She stops, looking to the name, Nichols,  Katherine age: 16. A girl. She looks to the cabin assignm "400." She notes that it is the same cabin where Greer wa found, when a REVERBERANT CONCUSSION SOUNDS THROUGH THE S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge runs to the side to see a 15 feet wide by 40 feet t steel and concrete mid-ocean buoy bounce off the transom the ship drifts into it.

dialogues.speaker: WITH GREER AND MURPHY
dialogues.text: They come to the side at the wheelhouse, seeing the brigh orange letters "NOAA" emblazoned on the buoy's float pod the ship drifts by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Noaa buoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Government weather. It's got a  transmitter aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge quickly ties a loop in a coil of docking line as Gr Epps, and Murphy look on at the approaching buoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, let's go, let's go. Dodge finishes as Epps ties the other end off to a cleat.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BUOY
dialogues.text: As it drifts along the side of the Chimera. Murphy drops line down, the buoy bouncing on the swell.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Murphy pulls the loop up as the buoy nears, aiming to hoo it on its wind gauge.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BUOY
dialogues.text: The buoy approaches, rising and falling with the swell.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Murphy corrects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Higher. You're gonna miss it. Murphy holds the loop steady.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BUOY
dialogues.text: The loop is too low. It's going to miss the mark as the b drifts toward it, when the swell drops and the buoy goes  down.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Murphy yanks on the line.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BUOY
dialogues.text: And the loop catches on the wind gauge.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: As the line goes taught he pulls his hands away just in t the line snapping hard against the rail. Below, the buoy  heels over as it's pulled.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BUOY
dialogues.text: It drops with the swell, the line stretching, then swingi the giant concrete buoy float into the side of the hull w a huge BOOMING CLANG.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The line is smoking with the friction, the steel railing  bowing a little with the weight as they look on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're still drifting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mooring hasn't come taught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not gonna hold us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BUOY
dialogues.text: As the buoy falls again with a swell and slams into the s of the ship. The water returns, lifting it high. The ship is dragging it back and it begins to rise up as mooring comes taught. The line rises with it and soon the buoy is at a steep angle as it comes out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The buoy is held fast between the docking line and its ow mooring.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BUOY
dialogues.text: The buoy rises fully from the water, all three tons of it and as it does, the wind gauge's steel mount begins to be

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: As they watch the buoy suspended over the water between t creaking docking line and its own underwater mooring cabl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fucking way.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BUOY
dialogues.text: The gauge mount snaps and the docking line flails free,  sending the buoy hurtling back into the water in a curtai of spray, whipping wildly from side to side.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The buoy swings back and forth as it rights itself, risin on a swell, passing beyond the bow of the Chimera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it. They look on in silence, the buoy slowly receding as the  ship drifts away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy stands watch by the fire as Epps joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish I could say the same. They watch the fire in silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think happened on this  boat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that's the sixty four thousand  dollar question, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. Before your time. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think at least some of the crew  went a little nuts. The usual stuff  that happens when people stumble on  a fortune. Equal parts greed and  paranoia, usually resulting in  homicide. What happened after that  is anybody's guess. But, judging by  our Greek friends down below, it  doesn't look like the last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we smart enough to avoid that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, are we? A beat as she looks back at him. She looks back to the fi watching it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you found me yesterday, at the  pool. I'd seen... something.  Someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not our mystery guest again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Someone else. A girl. (hesitating, a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure she was... real. She looks up to Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not real? A beat as she only looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, like some kind of ghost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what else you'd call  her. One second she was there, the  next she was gone. Another beat as he looks on at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I had a kind of hallucination. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were others. I saw them in the  pool. Drowning. A beat as Murphy looks back, as she sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe hallucination is the wrong  word. It was more than that. As though  they were showing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showing you what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it was one of them did the  handy work on those Greeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I think they are, were, just  passengers. Innocent victims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victims of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something bad happened here, Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That much I think we've already  established.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than just a mutiny. More than  just the gold. A beat as he holds there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said the ship was evil. That we  had to leave right away. That if we  didn't, we might never leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. A beat as she looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you? How come the rest of us  haven't seen these people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just lucky I guess. Another beat as he holds on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Getting off this ship's exactly  what we're trying to do.  Short of  that, I don't know what else to tell  you. She only looks back at him, then into the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor and wake up Dodge.   He's next on. She starts to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Epps? She stands, looking back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can tell the others about this.   But, for my money, I think it's best  you keep it to yourself. She holds there a beat longer, then turns, walking off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps comes to the 2nd officer's door, knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge. (no answer, knocking  again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally, from inside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps sits down on the bed. She lies back, not sleepy. A b as she holds there in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy still sits by the fire as Dodge groggily approache from the officers quarters, carrying a blanket and a jug water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing him the  shotgun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fall asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laying out his blanket)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer lies asleep on the bed. But his sleep is fitful,  increasingly agitated, tormented. It is as if he tries to speak, but cannot. As THE CAMERA PUSHES SLOWLY IN, his wo are forced and garbled, speaking in the same nonsensical  language he spoke earlier, when he wakes with a start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge dozes, cradling the shotgun in his arms, when MUSIC CAN BE HEARD VERY DISTANTLY. Dodge wakes. It is "Daisy"  playing on a music box somewhere in the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge moves along as the MUSIC BOX DISTANTLY CONTINUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge moves cautiously down the stairway into another  passageway. He approaches from the other end. He passes the open door of stateroom after stateroom. The MUSIC BOX IS CLOSER HER It stops. He holds there in the darkness. He turns, shining his lig back down the passageway. A beat. It is silent, when the  CHANNEL OF HIS RADIO OPENS WITH A SHORT BURST. He raises his radio. But no one says anything, the CHANNE REMAINING OPEN, a discernible presence on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge.

dialogues.speaker: FROM THE FAR END
dialogues.text: SLOWLY MOVING TOWARD DODGE as he can be seen from the oth end of the passageway.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: He gets no response, then presses the talk button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Dodge. Over. He is answered by silence, the CHANNEL REMAINING OPEN, WH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Cock-a-doodle-doo," said the rooster  to the crow. "Where are you now? I  know but won't say so." Dodge hits the talk button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this? The RADIO CHANNEL OPENS, but only silence comes back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Identify yourself, motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: FROM THE FAR END
dialogues.text: SLOWLY MOVING TOWARD DODGE as he can be seen from the far end of the passageway.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Only silence returns on the radio as Dodge holds there, t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penny whistle toy. Penny whistle  toy. THE CAMERA PUSHES SLOWLY IN ON DODGE as he listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penny whistle toy. Penny whistle toy -- . Dodge senses something behind him. He turns, and before h can draw a breath to shout, SOMETHING HEAVY SLAMS INTO HI IN THE DARKNESS, his flashlight tumbling away in a squigg of light.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHOTGUN
dialogues.text: As the shotgun clatters to the deck, the muzzle resting i frame as the radio falls a few feet away. A beat. The sho muzzle slides out of frame as some unseen person or thing pulls it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grey overcast stretches to the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy comes out onto the deck. Dodge is nowhere to be se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps shines her light on something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it out. Greer raises his light to reveal rows of canned goods. Th are industrial sized cans, from the 1950s. Greer takes on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even want to know what that's  gonna taste like now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than starving to death. Epps' radio CRACKLES AWAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy to Epps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising the radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either of you seen Dodge? She looks to Greer who shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not on deck and I can't raise  him on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge's stuff is laid out under the shelter of a vent duc as Greer, Epps, and Murphy stand over it. A blanket, a pi and a plastic jug of water are all that remain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took the shotgun and a light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must've heard something below deck  and went down to check it out. A beat as they hold there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. We stay together. Nobody  goes any further than earshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer and Epps move along as Murphy raises his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy to Dodge. Murphy to Dodge.   Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge's radio lies in the detritus of the ship as Murphy' voice can be heard on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy to Dodge. Do you copy? Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps moves cautiously along in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps? You there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here.

dialogues.speaker: WITH MURPHY
dialogues.text: As he moves along as well, eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer?

dialogues.speaker: WITH GREER
dialogues.text: As Greer moves along too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps jumps down, shining her light over machinery and acr bulkheads when a WHISPERING CAN BE HEARD somewhere. She h there, listening. It is echoey, distant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy? No response as Epps holds there. The WHISPERING SOUNDS AG far off, unintelligible. It stops. She moves on, shinning her light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps moves along in the darkness, holding the flashlight  before her, when the WHISPERING SOUNDS AGAIN. Epps stops, holding there in the silence. She reaches for her radio. The WHISPERING SOUNDS AGAIN. Epps turns to pin it, coming from somewhere in the cavernous space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps passes under a catwalk. She moves on, passing a row standpipes. Epps stops, listening. Somewhere, the WHISPER CAN BE HEARD, then stops. It is absolutely silent. In the darkness behind her, the  GIRL (KATIE) PULLS BACK INTO THE SHADOWS. Epps holds there a beat, then turns, running into Greer w a start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Didn't mean to scare you. She holds there a beat, looking around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Fine. I just thought I heard  something is all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Let's get outa here. They start to leave, when Epps notices something. She sto Beyond the standpipes, a faint glow can be seen in the  darkness. Epps steps forward, crossing to it. Greer follo

dialogues.speaker: EPPS
dialogues.text: As Epps approaches, Greer behind her. The light is dim an low to the deck. She stops.

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE LIGHT
dialogues.text: As Epps starts toward it again. She and Greer come up to stopping there. She kneels, the dim glow shining on her. reaches out toward it, pulling back Dodge's flashlight, s on. She turns it off, standing. She shines her light into the darkness and starts off, Greer following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps and Greer move along, shining their lights as they g when something catches in the beam of Epps' flashlight. It is Dodge's radio. They stop over it. Epps picks it up, inspecting it. She looks to Greer, when a single dark spo appears on Epps' cheek. It begins to run, a crimson tear. She raises her hand to touch it, inspecting her finger to see that it is blood. She looks to Greer. They both look up to see, hanging  suspended above them, Dodge's face staring back down at t from the darkness. He has been imperfectly impaled, the sharp point of a hig pressure steam pipe protruding from his neck, head hangin limp beside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer and Murphy lower Dodge's body on a rope as Epps gui it to the deck. They stand looking on at it a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't find the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So whoever did this now has our  shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't look like it much matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him till we can get some help. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From now on, nobody comes down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the gold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now hold up just a minute. Let's be  reasonable here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think whoever did this is  reasonable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I'm saying is that gold's worth  a lot more to us now than it ever  was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you. Dodge's dead  and all you can think about is cashing  in your share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't sign up to go home empty  handed. And I sure ain't gonna roll  over for the freaky motherfucker did  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's going anywhere with that  gold now. Anybody tries to board,  we'll know about it. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do what you want, Greer.   But neither of us is gonna risk saving  your ass down here if it comes to  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps enters the dim passageway from the bright daylight. moves down the passage, coming finally to the stateroom w Greer was found, room 400. She holds there a beat, then reaches for the door, hesita She opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door comes open and Epps steps in. It is dark, though spacious. It is divided into two rooms. Beyond the sittin room in the front, is a bedroom. Epps steps in. A dressing table sits against the far wall A large bed is unmade. Suitcases lie open on stands at th foot of the bed, still half full as if they were in the  process of being unpacked. From one, she pulls back a woman's gown, a blouse. The ot contains shirts, trousers, socks, and underwear. Across the room a smaller suitcase can be seen lying open an Ottoman in the corner. Epps crosses to it. She finds a few shirts, and a red print dress, some books. She takes of the books, opening it. Inscribed on the inside of the cover is: "This book belon to:" and then written in by hand: "Katie Nichols." A page is marked with a purple ribbon. She opens it to se children's poem "The Rooster and the Crow" and a drawing a rooster and a crow and a stanza of a poem: "'Cock-a-doo doo,' said the rooster to the crow. 'Where are you now? I know, but won't say so.'" She puts it down. A tin penny  whistle sits on the table. She picks it up, examining it. She opens a small picture book, thumbing through to see p of a family, a young mother and father at the beach, the  mother and a girl of about 9 years, the girl and an older girl of about 16, the girl she saw at the swimming pool,  KATIE. Epps holds on this picture, when A MUSIC BOX SOUND She looks up to the dressing table. On it a music box slo plays "Daisy."

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TABLE
dialogues.text: Epps crosses to it, looking on at the music box as it slo winds down, then finally stops. A beat. She picks it up,  looking at it, when she looks up to see Greer standing th A beat. The dirty white light falling into the room through the  windows falls on him as he looks off at something we cann see. His expression is empty, hollow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer? He does not hear her as he stands there. She approaches,  stepping up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? Another beat, as he looks off, into the light, when he sl turns to see her. A long beat as she looks back. He holds there, the same e look about him, when he grabs her by the throat and squee hard. She is stunned, breathless, but raises her hands to grip wrists, fighting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer! His grip tightens. He is much stronger and her efforts ma little difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go! She hangs on, starting to choke. She drops one hand, sear with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oragishlaoomnudrasadrafantoshviska  getofedobrodijotosiantosg. He speaks nonsense, his face distorted in an ugly grimace eyes bulging as Epps fumbles over the table, a tray of gl and silver crashing to the floor as he pushes her back, s choking her. He backs her to the wall, pushing in, closing her windpip the rest of the way. Her hand searches behind her, knocking over a small vase, basket, some books. It comes to a brass desk lamp. It fal a little out of reach. She is going to black out any second, as Greer strangles  her. Her hand comes to the desk lamp, grabbing it. She raises the lamp, swinging with all her might, connect with Greer's head. He stumbles back, a gash laid into his face, as Epps suck in air, gagging and coughing, her neck purple with finger marks.  She fumbles her radio up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy! I'm on C deck, cabin 400!   Get down here now!! Blood is running down his face as Greer comes for her aga She throws down the radio. A bed stands between them. She feints right, then left. H dazed and has blood in his eyes. She manages to slip by, he dives, taking her down. He drags her back along the floor, spinning her around. H raises a fist to ram into her face when WHAM! Epps has shoved the butt of her flashlight into his crotc and he comes up SCREAMING. He grabs her face, striking he with his other hand. She swings the flashlight again and cracks him across the head. He swings yet again and connects, knocking her acro the floor. She lies in a heap as Greer climbs to his feet, enraged a bleeding. He unbuckles his belt as he approaches, pulling it from h waist to do God knows what. Epps looks around to see him approaching. And we see that she has unhinged her gill knife. As his foot steps near, she lets go and drives the knife  with all her might into his boot, plunging the blade thro his foot and into the floor. He SCREAMS. After a moment he stops, looks to her. He is a bloody,  wretched, enraged mess. He starts toward her as Murphy ap in the doorway. Just as Greer is upon her, Murphy blind sides Greer from  behind at full speed, knocking him down. Greer and Murphy struggle as Epps climbs unsteadily to he feet. She staggers to them and raises the flashlight over Greer, bringing it down on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps and Murphy carry Greer's unconscious body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer tumbles down a sand bank in an empty aquarium. He s at the bottom, now starting to come to.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Murphy slams the door shut as Epps looks on. She puts a s pipe across the hatch lever so that it cannot be opened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer sits in the tank, visible through a large piece of  armored aquarium glass, amidst the fake coral. He sits in the sand hugging his legs to his chest, bobbing slightly he speaks in his nonsensical language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must've been him all along. Murphy and Epps look on from the outside in the promenade

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smashed the radio. Scuttled the boat.  Killed Dodge. Would've killed you.  He's off his nut, no doubt there. They watch him in silence a moment as Greer mutters and b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be a stroke. Who knows? (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The general log said the crew were  fighting among themselves. "Like  wild dogs."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it was more than that. Greer gets up, comes to the window, looking out at them. presses his face to the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They went crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy with greed. Not crazy. Not  like him. A beat as Epps looks off. In the window Greer drags his  hideously distorted face over the glass, the blood from h wounds smearing in broad red streaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A partial hull of a rotting life boat falls into frame. E and Murphy stand over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lash a few of these together it  might get us far enough into the  shipping lanes to be rescued. A beat as they look on at the rotting hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to say which is worse, staying  here or taking our chances in open  water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the weather holds it might not be  so bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the weather I'm worried  about. The wrong current could drag  us as far as the Aleutians before we  come across another boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps and Murphy work to lash parts of the rotting boats i a single usable raft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer lies asleep on the sand bottom of the tank, the whi light from the skylight falling on him from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps has found a reel of wire and some metal braces, maki her way into the darkness, when her radio CRACKLES TO LIF The channel remains silent a moment, then closes. She sto raises the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding down talk  button)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy? She waits, holding there as only silence comes back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy, this is Epps. Do you copy? Again, only silence comes back until, after a moment, the channel opens again. No one speaks, though there is a pal presence on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising the radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this? The channel opens again, only silence returning. The soun of the MUSIC BOX CAN BE HEARD, "DAISY" COMING BACK OVER T RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps walks along in the darkness AS THE MUSIC BOX CONTINU TO PLAY OVER THE RADIO. She comes to the end of the corri stopping there. At the other end the light falls from the door at room 40 The MUSIC FROM THE RADIO STOPS, leaving in its absence th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps approaches the other end, from where the MUSIC EMANA coming to a stop at room 400. A beat as she holds there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps steps in as THE MUSIC BOX PLAYS IN THE OTHER ROOM. The sitting room is dark as she holds there. After a mome she continues on, coming to the bedroom. Epps steps in. Across the room the MUSIC BOX IS PLAYING. She crosses, coming to it as it continues, when her radio CRACKLES TO LIFE. The channel remains silent a moment, th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Cock-a-doodle-doo, said the rooster  to the crow. Where are you now? I  know but won't say so." She holds there a beat, then crosses to the table to find the book of nursery rhymes. She opens it to the nursery r "The Rooster and the Crow," seeing the same words on the  page, when the radio CRACKLES AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penny whistle toy. Penny whistle  toy. Penny whistle toy. Penny whistle  toy. On the table is the penny whistle she saw earlier. She ta it, holding on it a moment. She raises it and THE CAMERA  SLOWLY PUSHES IN as she puts it to her lips and lightly b a C-SHARP WHICH BECOMES A C-SHARP FROM A PENNY WHISTLE ac the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Cock-a-doodle-doo, said the rooster  to the crow. Where are you now? I  know but won't say so." On the other side of the room, the younger girl from the  photo plays the penny whistle. She is sitting on the floo with the MOTHER who reads from the book we saw earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Cock-a-doodle-doo, said the rooster  to the crow. Where are you now? I  know but won't say so." Cassandra,  if you insist on playing that while  I read I'll just stop right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. The room is warm with light, restored to its original  condition some fifty years ago as Epps stands there, unse no longer holding the whistle. A man, the FATHER from the photos, steps from the bathroo wearing a new coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He certainly did shorten it, didn't  he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought this was all the rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe last year. Katie joins them from the outer room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about this year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your color anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it, daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well thank you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, how much longer before we  start moving again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're working on the engines, honey.  As soon as they fix them we'll be on  our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps steps from room 400 into the passageway. It is lit w sconces running its length and the elegant furnishings an objets d'art stretching to the far end are all in their  original condition. DISTANT MUSIC FROM THE BALLROOM CAN B HEARD as Epps stands there. She moves along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps walks in the passageway. Doors are open and she look in to see people doing various things, some packing and  putting their things in order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps walks down the passage, rounding the corner to see t STEWARDS fighting with a fourth MAN in a tuxedo. They lif him up and carry him off down the stairs as he shouts and protests. She moves on, through a pair of double doors, i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps moves through the now lighted storage area off the  galley. A group of CREWMEN stand around at the other end  and, as Epps nears, she sees that four figures can be see among them. They are four men, OFFICERS, swaying gently f the ship's movement as they hang from ropes around their  neck, dead. Epps keeps moving, through doors at the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A commotion can be heard at the other end of the passagew as Epps keeps moving. A WOMAN SCREAMS, and is cut off whe door slams shut. The DISTANT MUSIC HAS BEEN REPLACED WITH INDISCERNIBLE  SHOUTING, as of someone commandeering the microphone some As she walks, she passes an open door where several CREWM fight over a steamer trunk, which breaks open, scattering the contents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps walks along, coming to another door where a dead man and woman are laying in the middle of the room as a STEWA takes money from a wallet. The steward looks up, reaches  over and slams the door shut. She continues on. Another door stands open as she comes to it, back at room 400. She stops. A REPETITIVE SOUND CAN BE HEARD, coming f inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps steps in as the SOUND CONTINUES. She crosses the sit room, coming to the doorway of the bedroom to find severa MUTINEERS, some in stewards attire, others wearing ships  officers caps, obviously taken from their rightful owners The repetitive sound comes from here, bed springs. And, f between the men, a woman's bare legs hang over the end of the bed as a pair of man's legs in boots lie between them the bed rocking, the others looking on. Epps turns to see the father. He is on his knees, hands t behind his back as he is forced to watch from the foot of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a geometric pattern of a lotus on the Persian carpet at h feet. When she looks up again she sees what the father se The mutineer finishes, climbing off the woman. Another of the men pulls her up to reveal that she is no woman at al but Katie. The mother and sister lie in a bloody heap near-by as one the other mutineers steps up to Epps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like that, daddy? I'll show you  something else now. The mutineer steps back to the bed. He sits Katie down so that she faces us on the end of the bed. He raises an axe over her, bringing it down as the world becomes a whirlin blur --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The CAMERA STOPS ON KATIE standing on the other side of t room, now empty of people, returned to its shabby, abando state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't real. Epps looks back at her from the other side of the room wh she stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many bad things have happened here.   But you mustn't allow the evil inside.  I tell you this because you can see  me. The others can't. But you must  leave. You must leave. A LOUD GUNSHOT SOUNDS SOMEWHERE IN THE SHIP. When Epps tu back Katie is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps moves quickly along, raising her radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps to Murphy. Only WHITE NOISE COMES BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps to Murphy. Only WHITE NOISE COMES BACK as she rounds the corner out  onto the promenade. At the other end, the aquarium can be seen. As she approaches she sees that the tank is empty. Greer nowhere to be seen and the skylight at the top is broken  out. A GREAT BOOMING SHUDDER rocks the ship. A LOUD SCREECHING METAL follows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship's hull being scraped at the waterline by a jagge mid-ocean island no bigger than fifty or sixty feet acros The ship has entered a small archipelago of such islands, mine field for a drifting ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps moves quickly along, coming to the stairway, moving almost running into Murphy on his way down, carrying a ca duffle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hit land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in an island chain. It's only  a matter of time before we hit another  one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer's gone. He broke out of the  tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps and Murphy move quickly along, when another HUGE BOO shudders the ship and the SHRIEKING OF METAL follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship bounces off another of the small, jagged islands it drifts past, buckling the steel plate of the hull  precariously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy and Epps run toward the other end of the ship. As  they do, something can be seen lying in the middle of the passage some distance down.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE OTHER END
dialogues.text: Epps and Murphy slow to see that it is a body, lying face down in the passage. They step up. Epps kneels as Murphy looks on. She rolls t body over. It is Greer, dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
