dialogues.text: He's been shot. Murphy kneels too, looking on at Greer's lifeless eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy and Epps come up the stairway, crossing to the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Epps and Murphy come out, moving toward the make-do ra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It should be enough to get us to one  of those islands. Gimme a hand,  wouldya? She joins him and they lift it off its stand, taking it t the rail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prop it here. We need to pull these  braces off. There's a hammer on the  stand. There. Epps crosses back to the stands.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE STANDS
dialogues.text: Epps kneels. No hammer. She pulls back Murphy's canvas du folding back the flap to reveal a shotgun, the shotgun Do had when he died. A beat as she holds there, when Murphy's hand grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take that. A beat as she looks to Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you. He only looks back at her as she stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was only a matter of time before  somebody killed somebody. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw it coming as well as I did.   Dodge had his plans, starting with  scuttling the boat. And Greer too,  except he went nuts. Couldn't take  it, I guess. Could've happened in  the middle of downtown Anchorage.   But did it make him any less  dangerous? I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you killed them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way I figure it, it was them or  me. I thought putting Dodge up on  that pipe was a nice touch? Bought a  little time. Made it look like whoever  killed those Greeks was still around.  But it's just us on this ship. Us  and your... spirit friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now you're gonna kill me, is  that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want it to turn out this  way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy, don't you see what's  happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I see it pretty well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the ship. The ship's making you  think this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a little bit about human nature  and what I've seen only confirms  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a trap. There was no way we  were gonna get away with that gold.   Nobody ever does. It's just the bait.  This ship sucks people in and it  never lets them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think maybe you been on this boat  a little too long, with all that  supernatural mumbo jumbo. There's  nothing supernatural about greed.   And that's what it comes down to,  pure and simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a damn about the gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could believe that. Either  way, you know what I've done. I've  got no choice. He raises the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. He prepares to fire, when a CONCUSSION ROCKS THE SHIP. Ep ducks and Murphy fires, a spatter of buckshot shredding t vent behind her. A SCREECHING OF METAL DEEP IN THE SHIP S as she gets up, diving for cover as Murphy shuttles the g again.

dialogues.speaker: WITH EPPS
dialogues.text: Epps scrambles behind a deck vent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship has bounced off yet another small island, the ja rocks loudly scrapping the hull with a deafening shriek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy crosses toward the deck vent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no reason to make this any  more difficult than it has to be.

dialogues.speaker: WITH EPPS
dialogues.text: As Epps holds there she sees the vent opening. She pulls  herself up and climbs inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps climbs down the air shaft where a giant fan spans it width. She squeezes through the fan blades and drops down where several vent ducts lead in different directions bel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy comes to the vent duct where Epps went down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps crawls through. She comes to a vent that leads out t passageway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy runs quickly down the stairway, shotgun at the rea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vent is shoved out and falls to the metal catwalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CLANG FROM THE VENT SOUNDS HERE and Murphy stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps extends her feet and climbs down into the passage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy rounds the corner, moving on the same deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps moves along on a metal catwalk in the darkness when  something can be heard ahead of her. She stops. FOOTSTEPS SOUND at the end of the passage. Epps pulls bac into the shadows, holding there. The footsteps sound as if they are coming down stairs at other end, when the FOOTSTEPS STOP. Epps holds there, listening intently in the silence when, the other end, THE SOUND OF CREAKING METAL, as from a hat slowly opening, can be heard. It stops. All is silent, WH THE HATCH CREAKS AGAIN at the other end. She begins movin toward it. As she approaches, she can see that the hatch is half ope swaying slightly with the movement of the ship. A CREAKING SOUNDS behind her. She turns, just as Murphy s into view. She ducks as he fires and a spray of buckshot  ricochets off the metal around her. She scrambles on her belly as Murphy fires again. She swi down from the catwalk, letting herself fall to the next d

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BOTTOM
dialogues.text: Epps gets up, runs.

dialogues.speaker: WITH MURPHY
dialogues.text: Murphy climbs down a ladder to the lower decks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps moves quickly along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy follows, when A RUMBLING SOUND CAN BE HEARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps stops where she is in the cavernous engine room, loo on at the massive hull rising above her as the RUMBLING G IN INTENSITY. Though it seems to resonate throughout the  ship, it seems to originate from here, from directly belo as though the hull were being dragged over a rocky bottom She steps back as the sound grows still louder, until it  becomes absolutely deafening. The ship begins to shudder. The steel bulkheads visibly m and the steel plates in the hull can be seen to bend back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy slows and finally stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few rivets pop in the hull. Then a few more, as the RUM GROWS STILL LOUDER. Epps puts her hands to her ears and begins to back away,  when the RUMBLING REACHES A PINNACLE. The rivets are spri out of the hull like machine gun fire when the steel plat of the hull gives way, A MASSIVE CRAG OF ROCK SMASHING TH WITH A TREMENDOUS BOOM AND A TORRENT OF SEAWATER. Epps ducks for cover as the crag tears a diagonal line th the Chimera's hull like a jagged claw through paper in a  HORRENDOUS TUMULT OF NOISE AND STEAM AND SPARKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chimera is impaled broadside by a particularly deviou rock promontory of a small island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The giant claw begins to pull back, as the ship drifts of water pouring in behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship is drifting free of the island with the current, huge gash rising on its port side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive torrent sweeps over Epps as seawater pours in  through the breach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy stops where he is to see water rushing in at the e of the passage. He begins backing away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps is forced under as the water in the hull is already  half way up the side, the ship listing WITH A GREAT GROAN EXERTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy moves down the passageway, coming to the cargo  compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps comes up for air. A clatter of all manner of debris, tools and general detritus hammers against the far bulkhe as the ship eases over. A boiler breaks loose of its stay Epps looks up to see it coming right for her. She ducks u the water as the boiler slams into the bulkhead where she was.

dialogues.speaker: WITH EPPS
dialogues.text: Epps is forced down by the boiler, trapped between it and the bulkhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gold slides off the palette, crashing into the far wa Murphy hurries to it, collecting ingots and putting them his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps struggles under the water to free herself, but she i trapped, the heavy boiler and its broken stays caging her

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE THE WATER
dialogues.text: The level of the water has now almost completely reached deck above, filling the ship almost entirely below decks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water is threateningly high as Murphy pockets one las ingot and makes his way for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps is trying to pull back the boiler stays, without luc She swims down lower, finding a pipe fitting she pries at the stays, without luck, when a form drifts into view in murky water. Several more forms appear. They are human, suspended in t water. As Epps looks, the several forms have become many. They are the bodies of the dead she saw in the pool befor As they look on at her from where they are, one form emer It is Katie. She reaches toward Epps, as if beckoning her to take her  hand from the other side. Epps raises her hand, taking it The girl leads Epps down into the murky darkness where sh finds a way out. She takes her back further, coming to th breech, leading her out and into a cool green void of wat Katie stops at the breach. Epps turns to her. She only lo back at Epps. Epps turns away, swimming upward toward the light of the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps breaks through, gasping for air. She looks to see th Chimera, listing heavily to one side, its bow decks fully awash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy staggers through the flooded passage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chimera is getting lower in the water, the bow submer and the stern beginning to rise. Epps sees another small island some distance off. She beg swimming toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water runs down the stairway as Murphy struggles toward t top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps swims as the ship sinks in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A river of water rushes through as Murphy crosses with  difficulty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps reaches the jagged rock of the island. She pulls her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water rushes in as Murphy wades out onto the Chimera's to deck. He is heavily weighted down and periodically goes u as he half wades half swims, the length of the ship's aft portion rising above him as the bow sinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps collapses on the rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the ship moves lower, Murphy pushes off. He bobs under momentarily, then comes back up with difficulty. The forw smoke stack has dipped under and is now taking on water, current from the rushing water pulling him toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps looks on as the giant ship angles higher and higher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the ship dips lower, the rushing water forms an eddy t pulls at Murphy. Murphy struggles, too heavy to resist as is pulled closer and closer to the sucking maw that is th smokestack's opening. The ship sinks further and Murphy is pulled to the edge o the stack. He frantically grabs for something to hold on without success, until he is finally pulled into the smok stack and sucked into the bowels of the ship by the rushi water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epps sits perched under a rock out of the wind, looking o at the Chimera, her stern rising high above water as she  goes down, when the RUMBLE OF ENGINES CAN BE HEARD. She turns to see a Coastguard plane sweeping low over the Chimera, then banking back and flying right over as she s and waves her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coastguard plane flies by one more time, this time  dropping a survival pack. The Chimera's stern rises up out of the water, almost ver now, slipping further and further under. Epps looks on one last time, as the ship goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The afterdeck of the Chimera sinks slowly, slowly down, t CAMERA PUSHING IN TO "CHIMERA" as the name comes to the w then slips slowly beneath the surface. And THE CAMERA FOL MOVING INTO THE WATER to reveal that, beneath the surface there is no ship at all, only the vast empty depths of th ocean.

dialogues.text: THE END
